sen.j: 浅井 忠（あさい ちゅう、安政3年6月21日 (旧暦)（1856年7月22日） - 明治40年（1907年）12月16日）は、明治期の洋画家。
sen.e: Chu ASAI (July 22, 1856-December 16, 1907) was a Western-style painter in the Meiji period.
Chu ASAI (July 22, 1856 - December 16, 1907) was a Western-style painter in the Meiji period.
Chu ASAI (July 22, 1856 - December 16, 1907) was a Western-style painter in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 教育者としても貢献した。
sen.e: He also contributed as an educator.
He also contributed as an educator.
He also contributed as an educator.

sen.j: 佐倉藩(現在の千葉県佐倉市)の江戸屋敷に藩士・浅井常明の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: At the Edo residence of the Sakura Domain (currently, Sakura City, Chiba Prefecture), he was born the first son of Tsuneaki ASAI, a feudal retainer of the domain.
At the Edo residence of the Sakura Domain (currently, Sakura City, Chiba Prefecture), he was born the first son of Tsuneaki ASAI, a feudal retainer of the domain.
At the Edo residence of the Sakura Domain (currently, Sakura City, Chiba Prefecture), he was born the first son of Tsuneaki ASAI, a feudal retainer of the domain.

sen.j: 少年時代は現在の佐倉市将門町で1863年から1872年までを過ごした。
sen.e: Chu spent his childhood in an area today's equivalent of Masakado-machi in Sakura City, from 1863 to 1872.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Chu spent his childhood in an area, which is now called Masakado-machi in Sakura City, from 1863 to 1872.
Chu spent his childhood in an area, which is now called Masakado-machi in Sakura City, from 1863 to 1872.

sen.j: 佐倉藩の藩校・成徳書院(現在の千葉県立佐倉高等学校の前身。父・常明は、この成徳書院の校長をしていたこともある。)で四書五経などの儒教や武芸を学ぶ。
sen.e: He learned Confucianism including shishogokyo (the Four Books and Five Classics of Confucianism, the Nine Chinese Classics) and martial arts at domain's school, Seitoku Shoin College (the predecessor of Chiba Prefectural Sakura Senior High School. His father Tsuneaki had once worked as the headmaster of the college).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He learned Confucianism including shishogokyo (the Four Books and Five Classics of Confucianism, the Nine Chinese Classics) and martial arts at the domain's school, Seitoku Shoin College (the predecessor of Chiba Prefectural Sakura Senior High School where his father Tsuneaki had once worked as the headmaster of the college) in the Sakura Domain.
sen.cmt: wordingpuctuation rule (I think period shouldn't be used twice in the same cell)
sen.e: He learned Confucianism including shishogokyo (the Four Books and Five Classics of Confucianism, the Nine Chinese Classics) and martial arts at the domain's school, Seitoku Shoin College (the predecessor of Chiba Prefectural Sakura Senior High School where his father Tsuneaki had once worked as the headmaster of the college) in the Sakura Domain.

sen.j: そのかたわら、13歳の頃から佐倉藩の南画家・黒沼槐山に花鳥画を学んだ。
sen.e: At the same time, from the age of 13, he learned Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) from Kaizan KUROYAMA, a Nanga painter (an original style of painting in the Edo period which had a great deal of influence from the Chinese Nanga style) in the Sakura Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処, 「黒沼槐山」読み方不明
sen.e: At the same time, from the age of 13, he learned Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) from Kaizan KUROYAMA, a Nanga painter (an original style of painting in the Edo period which had a great deal of influence from the Chinese Nanga style) in the Sakura Domain.

At the same time, from the age of 13, he learned Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) from Kaizan KUROYAMA, a Nanga painter (an original style of painting in the Edo period which had a great deal of influence from the Chinese Nanga style) in the Sakura Domain.

sen.j: 「槐庭」(かいてい)の号を与えられ、この頃から才能の一端を現した。
sen.e: He was given the go (pseudonym) of 'Kaitei' and showed potential of his talent since then.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was given the go (pseudonym) of 'Kaitei' and showed potential of his talent since then.
He was given the go (pseudonym) of 'Kaitei' and showed potential of his talent since then.

sen.j: 1873年(明治6年)に上京。
sen.e: He migrated to Edo in 1873.
He migrated to Edo in 1873.
He migrated to Edo in 1873.

sen.j: はじめは英語の塾で学んでいたが、1875年(明治8年)に彰技堂で国沢新九郎の指導のもと油絵を学んだ。
sen.e: At first, he enrolled in a English-language school but transferred his school to Hyogido (art school), where he learned oil painting under the guidance of Shinkuro KUNISAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: At first, he enrolled in an English-language school but transferred to Shogido (Western-style private art school), where he learned oil painting under the guidance of Shinkuro KUNISAWA.
sen.cmt: article/ words removed/ explanation added/pronunciation corrected->reference: http://www.tulips.tsukuba.ac.jp/jart/mokuji/indexSa.html
sen.e: At first, he enrolled in an English-language school but transferred to Shogido (Western-style private art school), where he learned oil painting under the guidance of Shinkuro KUNISAWA.

sen.j: 1876年(明治9年)に工部美術学校に入学、西洋画を学び特にアントニオ・フォンタネージの薫陶を受けた。
sen.e: In 1876, he enrolled in Technology Arts School to learn Western-style painting, where he was influenced particularly by teacher Antonio Fontanesi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1876, he enrolled in Technology Arts School to learn Western-style painting, where he was influenced particularly by the teacher Antonio Fontanesi.
In 1876, he enrolled in Technology Arts School to learn Western-style painting, where he was influenced particularly by the teacher Antonio Fontanesi.

sen.j: 卒業後は、新聞画家としての中国派遣などを経験。
sen.e: After graduation, he was stationed to China as a painter for newspapers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After graduation, he was stationed to China as a painter for newspapers.
After graduation, he was stationed to China as a painter for newspapers.

sen.j: 1889年には浅井が中心になって明治美術会を設立した。
sen.e: In 1898, Asai played a leading role in the foundation of the Meiji Art Society.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1889, Asai played a leading role in the foundation of the Meiji Art Society.
In 1889, Asai played a leading role in the foundation of the Meiji Art Society.

sen.j: 1898年(明治31年)に東京美術学校(現在の東京芸術大学)の教授となる。
sen.e: In 1898, he became a professor at Tokyo School of Fine Arts (present Tokyo University of Arts).
In 1898, he became a professor at Tokyo School of Fine Arts (present Tokyo University of the Arts).
In 1898, he became a professor at Tokyo School of Fine Arts (present Tokyo University of the Arts).

sen.j: その後、1900年(明治33年)からフランスへ西洋画のために留学した。
sen.e: In 1900, he went to France to study Western-style painting.
In 1900, he went to France to study Western-style painting.
In 1900, he went to France to study Western-style painting.

sen.j: 1902年(明治35年)に帰国後、京都高等工芸学校（現在の京都工芸繊維大学）教授となった。
sen.e: After returning to Japan in 1902, he was assigned to a professor at Kyoto Higher School of Design (present Kyoto Institute of Technology).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After returning to Japan in 1902, he was assigned as a professor at Kyoto Higher School of Design (present Kyoto Institute of Technology).
After returning to Japan in 1902, he was assigned as a professor at Kyoto Higher School of Design (present Kyoto Institute of Technology).

sen.j: 個人的にも聖護院洋画研究所（後の関西美術院）を開いて、後進の育成にも努力した。
sen.e: He also opened his private school, Shogoin Institute of Western Art (present Kansai Bijutsuin, or Fine Arts Academy of Western Japan) and made effort to train younger artists.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He also opened his own private school, Shogoin Institute of Western Art (present Kansai Bijutsuin [Fine Arts Academy of Western Japan]) and made effort to train younger artists.
He also opened his own private school, Shogoin Institute of Western Art (present Kansai Bijutsuin [Fine Arts Academy of Western Japan]) and made effort to train younger artists.

sen.j: 画家としてだけではなく教育者としても優れた人物であった。
sen.e: He was excellent not only as a painter but also as an educator.
He was excellent, not only as a painter, but also as an educator.
He was excellent, not only as a painter, but also as an educator.

sen.j: また、正岡子規にも西洋画を教えており、夏目漱石の小説「三四郎」の中に登場する深見画伯のモデルとも言われる。
sen.e: Also, he taught Western-style painting to Shiki MASAOKA, and ASAI is said to be a model of Master Fukami, a painter who appeared in "Sanshiro," a novel by Soseki NATSUME.
Also, he taught Western-style painting to Shiki MASAOKA, and Asai is said to be the model of Master Fukami, a painter who appeared in "Sanshiro," a novel by Soseki NATSUME.
Also, he taught Western-style painting to Shiki MASAOKA, and Asai is said to be the model of Master Fukami, a painter who appeared in "Sanshiro," a novel by Soseki NATSUME.
